prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Taylor F. Ealy family papers(MS 162).Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Taylor F. Ealy worked as a missionary, doctor, and teacher.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains letters, diaries, and writings of Taylor F. Ealy and members of his family. Ealy operated the U.S. Freedmen's School for black children at Fort Arbuckle, Oklahoma, from 1874 to 1876. He lists pupils for August and September of 1875, and describes conditions at the time. In 1878, he relates their trip to Lincoln, New Mexico, as well as experiences during the Lincoln County War, while they held school and began a church. Writings by his wife, Mary, and daughter, Ruth, give their impressions of Billy the Kid. After moving to the Zuni Pueblo, Ealy describes life there in an 1879 diary. A diary from 1854-1856 by Henry B. Ealy, Taylor's first cousin and a minister in Pennsylvania is also present. Four diaries by Ruth Ealy describe a 1913 trip to Azores, North Africa, and Europe; a 1928 trip to Great Britain, and a 1937 trip to Japan. An undated typescript by her relates conditions of migrant farm workers' families in Tucson, Arizona. Photographs consist of six portraits of family members including Taylor and Mary Ealy.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Correspondence involving Mary R. Ealy is also located in the Maurice Fulton Papers (MS 57)

did.unittitle: Series III: Writings, 1875-1889
People and incidents at Fort Arbuckle, Indian Territory.
Lincoln, New Mexico: "Frontier," a short piece on Lincoln and the trip there, by Taylor F. Ealy. March 11, 1978
Lincoln, New Mexico: the trip to Lincoln and an incident during the Lincoln County War, by Taylor F. Ealy.
Lincoln, New Mexico: the trip to Lincoln, diary extracts from the Lincoln County War period with commentary, by Taylor F. Ealy.
Lincoln, New Mexico: "The Lincoln County- War, New Mexico as I Saw It," by Taylor F. Ealy, (incomplete: pp. 1-21, 39).
Lincoln, New Mexico: "The Lincoln County- War, New Mexico as I Saw It," by Taylor F. Ealy, (complete version, copied by Mary R. Ealy).
Lincoln, New Mexico: the trip to and from Fort Stanton for the Dudley court of inquiry, by Taylor F. Ealy.
Lincoln, New Mexico: notes on Billy the Kid, extracts from Pat Garrett's The Authentic Life of Billy the Kid, comments on principals of the Lincoln County War, by Taylor F. Ealy.
Lincoln, New Mexico: "To the Rocky Mountain Presbyterian;" comments on the Lincoln County War, by Taylor F. Ealy.
Zuni, New Mexico; Miscellaneous: "The old white mule," about an attempted trip from Zuni to Fort Wingate, by Taylor F. Ealy. June 26, 1889
Zuni, New Mexico; Miscellaneous: map of locations between Zuni and Albuquerque.
Zuni, New Mexico; Miscellaneous: note of formation (proposed?) of an association for building a library, by Taylor F. Ealy, (incomplete).
Zuni, New Mexico; Miscellaneous: "Migrants," by Ruth R. Ealy.
